contextId.information: This means "at all times" and can be translated using a phrase or word from your language or culture that gives the same meaning. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_merism]])
The Israelites considered these two cities their most southern and most northern cities. David uses these cities to refer to all of Israel. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_merism]])
AT: "every person" or "men of all ages" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_merism]])
